title: User Interface Software and Technology
cover: An illustration of 1's and 0's with a stick figure sitting on one, reading.
User interfaces are where people and technology meet.
unknown: An animated gif of television noise.
description:
The HCI community has a long history of innovation in user interface software and technologies, but there are few surveys or review of all of this research. This book attempts to summarize much of this knowledge, providing a living online textbook for UX designers, researchers, design-literate developers to learn from and leverage this ever-expanding body of knowledge.

I hope you enjoy! If not, please file an [issue|https://github.com/amyjko/user-interface-software-and-technology/issues/new] on the [the book's GitHub repository|https://github.com/amyjko/user-interface-software-and-technology/]
chapters: A photograph of the original computer mouse.
An illustration showing a person with models in their head and an interface with functions.
A photograph of a library in Gothenberg, Sweden
Interfaces mediate information, among other things, just like libraries.
An icon of a command line interface.
Programming was the first user interface.
A screenshot of the Xerox star user interface and it's word processing application and desktop
Graphical user interfaces did not have to be this way.
A modern architecture of an apartment building, figuratively resembling software architecture.
Architecture is how interface implementations are organized.
Some access technologies are a bandage for inaccessible designs
A photograph of a person touching an Apple Watch screen
A wearable device with particularly small targets
A photograph of a kitten sitting on a computer keyboard.
A standard text entry device and it's avid user.
Two human hands in the sun facing a blue sky
Hands are versatile tools for input.
Luisfi (Own work) [CC BY-SA 3.0] via Wikimedia Commons
A man and a woman playing XBox Kinect game.
A man and a woman playing XBox Kinect game with their bodies.
A screenshot of the original Pong video game with two paddles, a ball, and scores.
Pong, one of the earliest arcade video games was also one of the first software applications to use graphics.
A screenshot of Microsoft's Hololens Minecraft experience
A Makerbot 3D printer printing a nested dodecahedron.
A stick figure man looking frustrated at a computer screen.
Legal paperwork with Apple and Microsoft logos
A few small cases have shaped U.S. case law on interfaces.
The front desk of the University of Washington's CoMotion, which supports technology transfer from research.
Gaps between research and practice are numerous, but many things can help.
A photograph of a Ring Doorbell mounted on a brick wall.
revisions: Integrated CHI, UIST, and ToCHI proceedings
Integrated CHI, UIST, and ToCHI proceedings
